ModuleDescription:
Partial differential equations are used to provide quantitative, predictive models for the universe. We study the essential equations of classical mathematical physics, including the heat and wave equations.
Students will assemble a toolbox of mathematical techniques to solve initial and boundary value problems, including separation of variables, and Fourier series and integral transforms.
Prerequisite:
Instructor approval or
Both Ordinary differential equations (YSC2xxx) and any one of:
Mathematical methods for physical scientists (YSC2205), Foundations of Applied Mathematics (YSC3240), Linear Algebra (YSC2232)
